key_phrases: awards are more shared with deserving arts groups
not just large amounts given to a select few
if a group has been operating successfully for (let's say)10 years in Austin, they should be awarded
not just awarded on a score they received or didn't get high enough score, so they received nothing
They've proven that they have operated and given their work successfully to this community
barriers_identified: funding based solely on scoring excludes established groups
concentration of large awards to a select few
solutions_proposed: share awards more broadly with deserving arts groups
recognize and award groups with a proven track record in the community, not just those with high scores
